On the other hand, the Titanic's location is in saltier Atlantic waters, which might have more corrosion over time.

But wait, the Gulf of Finland is part of the Baltic Sea, which has cold temperatures, especially in the deeper parts. So if the Titanic were in the Gulf of Finland, maybe the cold would help preserve it. But I'm not sure if the actual conditions there would be better or worse than where it's currently located.
